concept.title: Previous Page Report
concept.shortdesc: A path report that provides detailed site path analysis by showing you the pages on your site that visitors viewed prior to seeing a selected page on your site.

conbody.p: For example, you may want to know from where the people that viewed Home Page came. In the table, you can do a search for Home Page or scroll until you find it listed in bold. The pages that were viewed before Home Page are listed underneath.

entry.p: Shows where visitors to each page come from. For example if you have a Features page, this report shows the top five pages your visitors came from to get to your Features page. This report:

ul.li: Identifies the route a visitor takes when entering a page on your site.
Lets you determine which pages feed visitors to important pages on your site.
Lets you analyze a sign-up page, for example, to understand which of your site pages is most effectively driving your visitors to subscribe to your services.

row.entry: A Flow report. You can specify the direction in the interface, and run the report at across visits or at the visit level.
